name: Taper Jean Girl
wikiSummary: "Taper Jean Girl" is a song by American rock band Kings of Leon. It is the third track on their 2005 album Aha Shake Heartbreak.  The album Aha Shake Heartbreak was named after the lyrics of this song. A fan favorite, the song is known for its tight spiraling guitar, barely discernible, unmistakably dirty chorus, and as Rolling Stone calls it, "a final double-time explosion that, frankly, doesn't go on long enough."[1] The song is featured in Entourage season 3 episode 12 "Sorry, Ari". The song is featured in the 2007 film Disturbia and plays during a scene as well as the closing credits.
wikiText:
"Taper Jean Girl" is a song by American rock band Kings of Leon. It is the third track on their 2005 album Aha Shake Heartbreak.  The album Aha Shake Heartbreak was named after the lyrics of this song. A fan favorite, the song is known for its tight spiraling guitar, barely discernible, unmistakably dirty chorus, and as Rolling Stone calls it, "a final double-time explosion that, frankly, doesn't go on long enough."[1] The song is featured in Entourage season 3 episode 12 "Sorry, Ari". The song is featured in the 2007 film Disturbia and plays during a scene as well as the closing credits. It is also featured in the 2008 film Cloverfield.
